posts.post_content:
T2, [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating)  
T3, Turn a land into an Artifact, Cast Phylactery Lich putting the counter on the land.   
T4, Turn the original Phylactery Lich into an Artifact EOT and cast another one, putting the counter on that Lich.   
  
Loops are fun. The original Lich then makes all other lich's indestructible.

posts.post_content: this is a 5/5 with indestructible in black. not green, BLACK. how does this not have at least 4 stars? the original has got like 4 and a half stars, and this ones got barely 3 and a half. what, is a 5/5 for 3 mana with indestructible not good enough for you? yeah, they can 2 for 1 it by killing an artifact, oh no a downside! god forbid we have cards that require a bit of strategy to use. this isnt like trying to figure out a use for [Nihilistic Glee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nihilistic Glee) where even if you make it work woop de doo it still sucks, this is a powerful creature for a reeeaally competative mana price. and besides, its not that hard to figure out how to use, as like 10 other people have said, use any card with [darksteel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=darksteel) and they're probably gonna have a hard time, and this all happens by turn 3! come on

Posted By: Arachnos (2/5/2013 12:43:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Rating differences:   
M11 = 4.4,   
M13 = 3.7.  
  
This is because M11 not only had some artifact support ([Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter), [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key), etc.) but M11 was followed by the second-most artifact-heavy set since it's ancestor: Scars of Mirrodin.  
  
What does M13 follow? Return to Ravnica: a primarily multi-coloured set.   
  
If they printed a multicoloured counterpart (maybe it was Esper or Jund-coloured) which needed to Phylact a multi-coloured permanent, then we'd be in business.
posts.html:
Rating differences:
M11 = 4.4,
M13 = 3.7.

This is because M11 not only had some artifact support (Ornithopter, Voltaic Key, etc.) but M11 was followed by the second-most artifact-heavy set since it's ancestor: Scars of Mirrodin.

What does M13 follow? Return to Ravnica: a primarily multi-coloured set.

If they printed a multicoloured counterpart (maybe it was Esper or Jund-coloured) which needed to Phylact a multi-coloured permanent, then we'd be in business.

Posted By: Osprey_93 (12/17/2012 7:06:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have a mono-black deck and I recently added two of these guys to it. I just play casual games with friends, so our decks are constructed of some old cards and some new ones from an assortment of sets. Obviously, anyone with the money to run 4 Mox cards in their deck has a great advantage over their opponent. But even then, when I can manage a 5/5 indestructible out on the first turn, it's a pleasant feeling.  
  
[Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp) and 1 [Mox Jet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Jet) to [Demonic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Tutor) for another [Mox Jet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Jet) to cast [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Dark Ritual) to summon my Lich. With the help of [Liliana's Caress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Caress), another [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) and two [Mind Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Twist)s later, my opponent was finished by turn 3. It was a lucky turn 3 draw for that second [Mind Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Twist), otherwise it would have been turn 4 unless he managed to pull something off.  
  
I usually prefer the games to last much long... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I have a mono-black deck and I recently added two of these guys to it. I just play casual games with friends, so our decks are constructed of some old cards and some new ones from an assortment of sets. Obviously, anyone with the money to run 4 Mox cards in their deck has a great advantage over their opponent. But even then, when I can manage a 5/5 indestructible out on the first turn, it's a pleasant feeling.

Swamp and 1 Mox Jet to Demonic Tutor for another Mox Jet to cast Dark Ritual to summon my Lich. With the help of Liliana's Caress, another Dark Ritual and two Mind Twists later, my opponent was finished by turn 3. It was a lucky turn 3 draw for that second Mind Twist, otherwise it would have been turn 4 unless he managed to pull something off.

I usually prefer the games to last much long... (see all)
